Issues.Title: Infinite hang when an added TreeNode forms a recursive hierarchy
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.100-preview-009812
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework? Yes

**Problem description:** A typo caused the wrong node to be added while constructing a hierarchy, causing a hang that was difficult to spot.

**Actual behavior:** Infinite hang in this loop:

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/fa4cdb0f50f8a64044a9d2baa192c53f6326f3e9/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/TreeNode.cs#L1575-L1576

```
System.Windows.Forms.dll!System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode.FindTreeView()
System.Windows.Forms.dll!System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode.TreeView.get()
System.Windows.Forms.dll!System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode.Realize(bool insertFirst)
System.Windows.Forms.dll!System.Windows.Forms.TreeNodeCollection.AddInternal(System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode node, int delta)
System.Windows.Forms.dll!System.Windows.Forms.TreeNodeCollection.Add(System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode node)	
```

**Expected behavior:** Just like the `Control.Controls` hierarchy, an exception should be thrown explaining that a TreeNode cannot be added as a descendant of itself.

**Minimal repro:**

```cs
var node = new TreeNode();
node.Nodes.Add(node); // Infinite hang
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Infinite hang when an added TreeNode forms a recursive hierarchy" (#358)

Issues.Title: Fully-themed controls
Issues.Body:
If you want to obtain a native look and feel in your projects, you currently have to redo minor implementations over and over to obtain these effects:

- Getting the fade effects on some common controls (Buttons, Checkboxes, Radiobuttons, Textboxes, Comboboxes)
- Getting images working on Buttons while preserving fade effects
- Getting the fade effects on Toolbars
- Getting the new theming on MainMenus and ContextMenus
- Getting CommandLinks and SplitButtons
- Getting different colored Progressbars
- Getting the explorer-like interface for ListBoxes and TreeViews 

Articles like this one explain how: https://www.codeproject.com/Articles/18858/Fully-themed-Windows-Vista-Controls (has images)

Would you consider including some or all of these upgrades in the box? I'm willing to contribute.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Fully-themed controls" (#357)

Issues.Title: An error dialog pops up after left-double-click "NETCoreTest" project to check the .csproj file
Issues.Body:
**OS:** RS4 x64
**VS:** 16.0.0 Preview 2.0 [28522.59.d16.0]
**.NET SDK:** .NET Core 3.0.100-preview-010143
 
**More info:**
1.	This issue also can reproduce on Console and Class library .net core applications.
2.	The issue can’t reproduce on 16.0.0 Preview 1.1 [28408.50.d16.0] + latest NET Core 3.0.100-preview-010143.
 
**Steps to reproduce:**
1.	Install .NET Core 3.0 SDK available from https://github.com/dotnet/core-sdk.
2.	Create a Winforms .Net Core application by command: dotnet new winforms –o “NETCoreTest”.
3.	Open the project and left-double-click "NETCoreTest" project to check the .csproj file.
 
**Actual:**
An error dialog pops up. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38325459/51594368-3edb6380-1f2f-11e9-9ed9-cf6d1ec8fcdd.png)
**Getting more info from here:**
[\\\trinlab2\BAQAFiles\v-zhgl\New folder\ActivityLog.xml](url)
 
**Expected:**
No error dialog pops up.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "An error dialog pops up after left-double-click "NETCoreTest" project to check the .csproj file" (#347)

Issues.Title: Split build steps
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Split build steps" (#342)

Issues.Title: Split restore/build, test, and pack/sign/publish into their own steps
Issues.Body:
- The build step currently does restore, build, test, sign, pack, and publish
- This can be difficult to troubleshoot on error at first glance
- The PR splits these tasks into different physical yaml steps
- This adds negligible build time since we still only restore and build once, we're just moving the other tasks into their own build steps
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Split restore/build, test, and pack/sign/publish into their own steps" (#341)

Issues.Title: The height of the "DropDown" list for the combobox control can't be reset default height after called the " comboBox1.Items.Clear();" method
Issues.Body:
**OS** : RS4 X64+.Net 4.8.03316
**VS** : Dev16 d16.0stg 16.0 Preview 3 28505.103

**More info:**
1. This issue can reproduce from VS Dev10 to Dev16.  
2. This issue can't reproduce when adding the following code to Form1.Designer.cs.
```
comboBox1.Items.AddRange(new object[] { "a", "b", "c", "d", "e" });
comboBox1.Items.Clear();
```
**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a Winforms application.
2. Drag a Combobox control to form designer.
3. Add the following code to Form1.cs.
 ```
private void Form1_Load(object sender, EventArgs e)
        {
 comboBox1.Items.AddRange(new object[] { "a", "b", "c", "d", "e" });
           comboBox1.Items.Clear();
}
```
**Actual:**
The height of the "DropDown" list for the combobox control can't be reset default height after called the " comboBox1.Items.Clear();" method.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864649/51449528-6b448380-1d67-11e9-9549-e6e17359c988.png)

**Expected:** 
The height of the "DropDown" list for the combobox control should be reset default height after called the " comboBox1.Items.Clear();" method.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864649/51449518-61bb1b80-1d67-11e9-8240-5ab5d7b5f8ae.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The height of the "DropDown" list for the combobox control can't be reset default height after called the " comboBox1.Items.Clear();" method" (#339)

Issues.Title: WinForms needs to remove System.Drawing.Design.Primitives
Issues.Body:
**Problem description:**
https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/pull/33452 removed the System.Drawing.Design.Primitives assembly from CoreFx with the POR that the types would be added to WinForms.  When this happened it was too close to Preview1 so we delayed these moves.   It looks like that work was never resumed after Preview1.


**Actual behavior:** 
Old copy of System.Drawing.Design.Primitives.dll in the desktop shared framework.

**Expected behavior:**
No old copy of System.Drawing.Design.Primitives.dll in the shared framework.

**Minimal repro:**
Install latest SDK and examine "C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App\3.0.0-preview-27318-3\System.Drawing.Design.Primitives.dll"

The fix for this should be to add the API for this assembly to WinForms, remove all uses of System.Drawing.Design.Primitives in this repository, then remove the redistribution of that dll from dotnet-trusted once WinForms change flows in.

/cc @dreddy-work @AdamYoblick
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WinForms needs to remove System.Drawing.Design.Primitives" (#340)
